lines.text: I don't like his eyes. I don't trust him.
Well, that's strange, when I'm so fond of you.
To think I was lured to this uninhabitable land to risk me life with amateurs!
I could see by the look of defeat about you that you were one of the amateurs.
You have the honor to address Colonel Francis Burke, gentleman of Dublin, chevalier of France, and hunted refugee of a devastated ragtag army.
Now be off with you while I still have stomach to eat. And if you've got any of those screeching bagpipes about, please don't toot them so I can hear.
Now, one of two things, Irishman. Either we fight on the spot, or we be comrades. Which is it to be?
Cut each other's throats or be friends for life - either way, is it?
It makes no difference to me.
And how do we make the decision?
Heads, we fight.
[He flips a coin]
Tails. Good. I'm a wee bit tired at the moment.

[Grabbing him from behind]
Not a sound, if you don't want a dirk in your ribs.
Is this how you usually meet people?
It cuts out the lengthy formalities.
Is it gold you want? Why, I'll bring you gold from the bottom of the sea. And here's the shirt from me back, and here's me hand.
We need money! It's blood for our veins! It's air for the lungs of us!
Where's the passage money?
Now, faith, how can you speak of such a vulgar thing in the presence of a hero of Culloden, and a wounded one at that?

[Looking uneasily at the gun Burke is pointing at him]
What do you expect to do with that?
Well, it has a certain quality of persuasion.

[Watching Burke being kissed by several girls]
Burke, come on!
Would you have me leave these poor, lonesome bits of depravity? I'm about to enrich the lives and experience of them!

[Seeing Burke being kissed by several girls]
Burke, on your way.
Not again, Jamie. The dear helpless females want comforting. Where's the heart of you?
Jamie, you're a wicked, wicked lad, and harm will come to me reputation for letting you lead me to piracy!

[Listening to Jamie trying to read aloud the Latin inscription on a ring]
"Lift up the eyes," you're saying, unless my Latin professor was a lying fraud.
Burke, we've got to get out of here.
And what could be simpler? The guard could have no objection to that!
I'm sure of it now! Your whole line is pure-blooded Irish!

[to Jamie]
There's almost a lift in the sky out there, and the minutes will be racing for it. Not much time to remember all the girls you've known, all the laughter you've heard, all the gold you've spent, and all the plans you had to spend more. The places we've not seen, Jamie! The things that lie about the world... the fun of it!

[Impressed with Durie's fencing ability during their duel]
You've been studying my style, Monsieur.
I've a style of my own, thanks.
Your brother's notions of business extend no further than...

[Cautioning]
MacKellar... !
...the cottage of Jessie Brown.
I'm thinking you're an envious old man.
I'm thinkin' there's a season for sowing oats and a time to plow them under.
I'll tell him that. He'll be most impressed.

[Hearing screaming on the deck]
My quartermaster is amusing himself with the prisoners. He has a taste for it... We give every prisoner a choice. They may join us or not.

[Angered that Jamie is choosing to join the rebellion]
We'll fight if he has anything to do with it! Life is too quiet here! It isn't exciting enough! There must be flying banners, clashing swords, blood on the ground before breakfast!
You're going out?
You won't be happy till you've torn us apart completely. I'll not stand in your way!
That girl's going to make a devil of a wife.

[Turning as she's leaving]
Your father had a devil of a son.
[Jamie laughs heartily]

[Running toward Janie as he arrives on the island and throwing he arms around him]
Oh, this one's mine! He's mine!

[Sarcastically]
Oh, darling, if only you weren't so shy.

[to Bull after he mistreats a woman]
Has anybody told you you were a swine?
Why, you swindling scum of a coward! You mouse-hearted imitation of a man! You green crawling snake that slipped up from the slime when your thieving mother wasn't looking!
